description: From Middle English clotty, equivalent to clot +‎ -y. Compare German klotzig (“bulky, massive, huge”).

adjectives.description: clotty (comparative more clotty, superlative most clotty)

examples: When it was brought to the school it discharged from its right nostril, a whitish, viscid, clotty matter, which, although of little consistence, strongly adhered to the sides of the nostril.
